III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 10/25/24, a staff was trying to keep a youth from fighting and
restrained him improperly by shoving the youth to the ground onto
the concrete. The youth obtained a scrape and bruise on the right
upper thigh.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed via telephone on January 7, 2024, in
collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Youth A said on October
25, 2024, there was a fight between him, Youth B, Youth C, and
Youth D [2025SIC000015]. Youth A said while Supervisor Z and
Staff 1 were trying to separate Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D,
Lead Supervisor pushed him to the ground forcefully leaving a
scrape on the back of his upper right leg. Youth A said he told
other staff about the situation, but he was unable to remember
who he told. Youth A said he does not know if anyone else saw it
happen as the youth were fighting and staff were dealing with the
fight.
Youth B was unable to be interviewed as he is currently
AWOL and his whereabouts are unknown.
Youth C was unable to be interviewed as he is currently
AWOL and his whereabouts are unknown.
Youth D was unable to be interviewed as his whereabouts are
unknown. Youth D was discharged from Clarence Fischer Center
to Wayne County Juvenile Detention Center however is no longer
at that placement and his mother is not answering her phone or
returning phone calls to provide information on his whereabouts.
2

Youth E and Youth F were interviewed face-to-face at the
facility on January 14, 2025. Neither Youth E nor Youth F were
present during the October 25, 2024, incident. Neither Youth E or
Youth F reported seeing Youth A with any marks, bruises, or
scrapes on the back of his upper right leg. Neither Youth E or
Youth F reported any concerns with Lead Supervisor’s interaction
with them or any other youth.
Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on January 14, 2025.
Staff 1 reported he was involved in the incident on October 25,
2024, where Youth A, Youth B, and Youth D all “jumped” Youth C
[2025SIC000015]. Staff 1 said Lead Supervisor was present and
had Youth A standing near him. Staff 1 said he never saw Lead
Supervisor push Youth A to the ground, noting he was very
preoccupied with trying to intervene in the other situation so was
not paying attention either. Staff 1 denied seeing any bruise or
scrape on the back of Youth A’s upper right leg after the incident or
anytime that he has worked with him.
Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone on January 16, 2025.
Staff 2 reported she was involved in the incident on October 25,
2024, where Youth A, Youth B, and Youth D all “jumped” Youth C
[2025SIC000015]. Staff 1 said Lead Supervisor was present and
had Youth A standing next to him throughout the incident. Staff 2
said she never saw Youth A on the ground. Staff 2 said she never
saw Lead Supervisor push Youth A on the ground. Staff 2 said
Youth A did not show her or talk about an injury on the back of his
upper right leg that night or anytime she has talked to him.
Supervisor Z was interviewed via telephone on January 14,
2025. Supervisor Z reported he was involved in the incident on
October 25, 2024, where Youth A, Youth B, and Youth D all
“jumped” Youth C [2025SIC000015]. Supervisor Z said Lead
Supervisor was present and was standing with Youth A “by his
side” and never had his “hands on [Youth A]”. Supervisor Z said
Lead Supervisor was on restrictions so would not have been going
hands on anyways.
Lead Supervisor was interviewed face-to-face at the facility
on January 14, 2025. Lead Supervisor said he has “no memory”
of being present on October 25, 2024, during the incident with the
youth fighting. Lead Supervisor said there have been many times
when he has had Youth A near him or by his side due to trying to
separate Youth A from the “older youth” in the program. Lead
Supervisor said Youth A will often upset the other youth in the
program and they will try to “go after him” so he attempts to
3

protect him by keeping him away from the other youth. Lead
Supervisor denied ever pushing Youth A to the ground. Lead
Supervisor denied ever seeing Youth A fall to the ground. Lead
Supervisor denied ever seeing bruises or scrapes on Youth A’s
upper right leg, stating that part of his leg would always be
covered with shorts or pants anyways.
Documents Reviewed:
• Youth A’s nursing notes for October 2024, were reviewed.
There was no documentation for any leg injury or any injury
on October 25, 2024.
• Lead Supervisor personnel file: Lead Supervisor had a
warning on November 25, 2024, for failure to complete
holiday schedules. Lead Supervisor participated in
Supervisor training on December 11, 2024.
• Wolverine Human Services Behavior Support and
Management Policy was reviewed. The approved
techniques for staff to utilize during a physical restraint do
not include pushing a youth to the ground.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per staff and youth
interviews there was not enough information to support a rule
violation that Lead Supervisor threw Youth A to the ground,
resulting in a scrape to his upper right thigh.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
